text.section: This section applies to an action for divorce in which issues of child support, custody, or visitation are raised.

Prior to granting a decree of divorce, the court may require all parties to participate in an educational seminar that is designed to educate parents about the effects, and to minimize the disruption, of a divorce on the lives of children.

section.section: The Court of Appeals shall adopt rules to implement this section.

text.section: The seminar required under this section may be provided under contract with a public or private agency.

Unless the parties stipulate otherwise, any information about a party, including statements or reports, obtained from an educational seminar required by this section, is not admissible during the action for divorce of that party.
This section may not be construed to require the parties to an action for divorce to attend the educational seminar together.
